intro: Hedyotis nigricans var. angulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bladdernut, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties.
